div1.p:
United States Commercial Agency.
St Paul de Loanda Sept 14th 1865

On the 7th inst. I received an invitation from one of the Chief Justices of the City to assist, as witness, the sealing up of the Brazilian Consular Archives in few hours after the death of the Acting Brazilian Consul of this City. I found the Judge with two Brazilian Gentlemen perusing and commenting upon the Brazilian Consular Regulations. My attention was called to an article of the Regulations wherein it was written that whenever a Brazilian Consul should
Hon William H. Seward
Secretary of State
Washington D.C.
should die, it was requested of the competent Authority to cull together two Brazilian subjects and a Consul of some friendly nation, to witness the sealing up of the Archives and to invite said Consular Officer to take charge of the duties of the Brazilian Consulate until His Imperial Majesty should be pleased to fill the vacancy.

I considered it my duty under the circumstances to cheerfully accept the duty thus assigned to me and in my Despatch to His Excellency the Minister of Foreign Affairs of Brazil copy of which I herewith enclose; I say to His Excellency that I am moved with pride as the Representative of the United States in this country to
have it in my power to be of service to this friendly Empire of Brazil. I also addressed His Excellency the Governor General of the Province on the subject copy of which I have also the honor to enclose.
I am confident the Department will approve of my proceedings in this case founded as I suppose they are, upon the correct principle of International Courtesy.

I have the honor
To be
Your most obedt Servant
Augustus Archer Silva
Commercial Agent

United States Commercial Agency
St Paul de Loanda Sept 14th 1865
Sir

It devolves upon me the unpleasant duty to inform Your Excellency of the death of Stamizo Luis de Santos, the Acting Representative of the Brazilian Nation in this City which took place on the 7th of the present month.

In compliance with an invitation received from Dr Carlos Pacheco de Bettencourt "Juiz de Direito" (Chief Justice) of this District. I assisted the sealing of the Archives, and accepted the invitation to assume charge of the duties of the Brazilian
His Excellency
The Minister of Foreign Affairs
Empire of Brazil
Brazilian Consulate until it should please Your Excellency to appoint another to fill the office: "The Juiz de Direito" pointed out to me, the Brazilian Consular Regulation, previous to sealing the Archives, wherein it requested that in case of death of Brazilian Consular Officer, the duties of the Consulate by should be given to a foreign Consular Officer, whose nation was on friendly terms with Brazil: I had the privilege to have this honor offered to me, and in accepting the responsibility, I am moved with pride, as the representative of the United States in this City, to have it in my power to be of service to the friendly Empire of Brazil.

Considering myself, under the circumstances, fully empowered by the
"Juiz de Direito", to act on behalf of Brazilian interest, in this Province; I have this day sent a note to His Excellency the Govenor General of the Province, informing him of the fact for his Government: I have the honor to enclose a copy of this note and His Excellency's reply, and also a "Public Instrument" of the "Aide de Deligencia" drawn up by the "Juiz de Direito" soon after Mr Ramizo Luis de Santos expired, signed by several Brazilian witnesses and others, including myself, wherein is also stated the Authority which confers upon me the honor to address Your Excellency.

Not having in my possession the Archives of the Brazilian Consulate for reference and information. I may not carry out exactly the wishes of the
Brazilian Government, but nevertheless will endeavour, guided by the Consular Regulations of the United States to protect the interests of your nation and arm of its subjects requiring assistance.

A copy of this Despatch I have considered proper to send to His Excellency the Brazilian Minister at Lisbon, that he may inform Snr Manoel Sobral Pinto of the circumstances who I understand still holds His Imperial Majesty's Commission as Consul for the Empire of Brazil in this City.
With the assurance of my highest respect.

I have the Honor to be
Your most obedt Servant,
Augustus Archer Silva
Commercial Agent

United States Commercial Agency
St Paul de Loanda Sept 14th 1865.
Sir,

I was invited on the 7th inst by Dr Carlos Pacheco de Bettencourt, Juiz de Direito of this district to meet him at the house of the late Ramizo Luiz de Santos, the acting representative of the Brazilian Nation, who died on that day, to assist as witness the sealing of the Archives of the Brazilian Consulate, and to assume charge of the duties and interests of the Brazilian Nation in this city until his Imperial Majesty should
His Excellency
José Baptista de Andrade
Governor General of the Province of Angola.
should be pleased to appoint another.

The illustrious Juiz de Direito acted upon the Brazilian Consular Regulation, which he perused before sealing the Archives, wherein it was written, that in case of death of a Brazilian Consular Officer, a Consular Agent of a friendly nation should be invited to take charge of the Brazilian Consulate during the vacancy of the said office. I had the pleasure to have this honor conferred on me, and as the representative of the Untied States I am moved with pride. I have it in my power to be of service to a nation so
friendly to my country.

I have the honor to enclose a copy of the "Auto de Deligencia" for your information and trusting to merit at the hands of your Excellency, the same attention and consideration in the discharge of my additional duties as it has been my good fortune to receive as Commercial Agent of the United States.

I have the Honor
To Be
Your most obedt Servant
(Sg) Augustus Archer Silva
Commercial Agent
